title: Anne Hathaway congratulates Zoe Kravitz for landing role of Catwoman in new Batman film
text:
She played Catwoman in 2012 Christopher Nolan directed The Dark Knight Rises.

And on Tuesday, Anne Hathaway shared a red carpet snap of Zoe Kravitz as she congratulated her on landing the iconic role in the Batman film.

Anne, 36, wrote: 'The biggest congrats to @zoeisabellakravitz on landing the role of a lifetime. Well, one life anyway... Enjoy the ride, Selena #Catwoman,' adding a lips emoji.

Well deserved: Anne Hathaway shared a red carpet snap of Zoe Kravitz as she congratulated her on landing the iconic role in the reboot of the Batman film.

Zoe's stepfather Jason Momoa shared a snap of the two of them on his Instagram page as he congratulated her as well.

The Aquaman actor wrote: 'I'm so proud of u zozo bear. On and off screen OHANA. DC WB ohana Lola and Wolfies big sister is CAT WOMAN. Unbelievable so freaking stoked. Your going to have so much fun Aloha P bear.'

Zoe, 30, commented on the picture: 'LOVE YOU PAPABEAR! love that aquaman and catwomen spend the holidays together from now on.'

Zoe's casting as Catwoman in the upcoming Batman film comes after Robert Pattinson landed the role of the Caped Crusader.

Blast from the past: She played Catwoman in 2012 Christopher Nolan directed The Dark Knight Rises; pictured in the film

Film: Anne was the last to star as Catwoman in the Christopher Nolan directed version in 2012 called The Dark Night Rises; pictured October 10, 2019 at the Modern Love premiere in NYC

The news was announced by Variety on Monday morning.

According to the website, Zoe was in the running for Catwoman alongside Zazie Beetz, Eiza Gonzalez and Alicia Vikander.

The Big Little Lies star landed the role despite worries about scheduling due to her filming Fantastic Beasts, Variety reported.

The new Batman film, directed by Matt Reeves, is set to start filming late 2019 or early 2020 with a release date set for June 25, 2021.

So proud: Her stepfather Jason Momoa shared a snap of the two of them on his Instagram page as he congratulated her

Ben Affleck was supposed to reprise his role as Batman but dropped out.

Zoe has voiced the character Catwoman in 2017's The Lego Batman Movie that had Will Arnett as Batman.

Anne was the last to star as Catwoman in the Christopher Nolan directed version in 2012 called The Dark Night Rises.

Zoe claimed in a 2015 Nylon magazine interview that she had tried auditioning for that film but that she was prevented from doing so because she was too 'urban.'

Star: Zoe claimed in a 2015 Nylon magazine interview that she had tried auditioning for that film but that she was prevented from doing so because she was too 'urban;' pictured May 29, 2019 at the Big Little Lies premiere in NYC

She was convinced that she had lost out on a chance to appear in the blockbuster Batman film, which starred Christian Bale as the title character.

'In the last Batman movie [The Dark Knight Rises], they told me that I couldn’t get an audition for a small role they were casting because they weren’t "going urban,"' she explained.

'It was like, "What does that have to do with anything?" I have to play the role like, "Yo, what’s up, Batman? What’s going on wit chu?"'

The star, who is the daughter of rocker Lenny Kravitz and actress Lisa Bonet, didn't specify in the interview who stood in her way when it came to auditioning or what role they held in the process.

Though they only used the term 'urban' when preventing her from auditioning, the term is often used as a euphemism for race.

Halle Berry played the title character in the Catwoman feature film in 2004; Michelle Pfeiffer was Catwoman in Batman Returns in 1992.

Julie Newmar played her for two seasons in the sixties series Batman and Eartha Kitt played her in season three.

Lee Meriwether played Catwoman in the 1966 film Batman.

Zoe reprised her role as Bonnie Carlson in season two of Big Little Lies as well as having just wrapped her new TV series High Fidelity, which will debut on Hulu.

Iconic: Michelle Pfeiffer was Catwoman in Batman Returns in 1992
